required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study To Test Whether PF-00547659 Is Safe And Improves Disease Symptoms In Patients With Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Dose-ranging Study To Evaluate The Efficacy And Safety Of Pf-00547659 In Subjects With Crohn's Disease (Opera)

brief_summary.textblock: Adults with Crohn's disease that is clinically active despite conventional treatment will be eligible for this study. Patients may receive one of three doses of PF-00547659 (experimental drug) or placebo (inactive drug). Disease activity will be measured every two weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) 70 Response Rate
primary_outcome.description: Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a number which consists of information collected from a 7-day diary from the participants regarding symptoms. Remission is considered a score of 150 or less. Active disease is considered 200 or greater. A response to therapy is considered a decline in CDAI score of 70-points from baseline. CDAI response rate at week 8 and week 12 was measured between the investigational product group and the placebo group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of PFâ€‘00547659 Dose Levels Versus Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse events (AEs), withdrawals due to AEs and Serious AEs (SAEs) were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Adverse Events (AEs) - PF-00547659 Dose Levels Versus Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Number of adverse events (all causalities and treatment related) was reported between the investigational product groups and the placebo group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with a CDAI remission (defined as a CDAI reduction to <150 points).

secondary_outcome.measure: Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI)-70 Response Rates Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI)-70 response were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) -100 Response Rates Over Timer
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI)-100 response were reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 20, Week 28, Week 36
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed cumulative incidence of anti-drug antibodies development to PF-00547659

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Total PF-00547659 - Area Under the Concentration Time Profile From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time (AUCinf)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total PF-00547659 was characterized using a population PK approach. PK parameters including but not limited to area under the concentration-time profile (AUC), clearance (CL) and half life were estimated using data pooled from both typical and additional PK groups. AUCinf is area under the concentration time profile from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Total PF-00547659 - Area Under the Concentration Time Profile From Time Zero to Time Tau (AUCtau)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total PF-00547659 was characterized using a population PK approach. PK parameters including but not limited to AUC, CL and half life were estimated using data pooled from both typical and additional PK groups. AUCtau is area under the concentration time profile from time zero to time tau, the dosing interval, where tau = 672 hours (4 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Total PF-00547659 - Maximum Observed Concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total PF-00547659 was characterized using a population PK approach. PK parameters including but not limited to AUC, CL and half life were estimated using data pooled from both typical and additional PK groups. Cmax is maximum observed concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Total PF-00547659 - Time for Cmax (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total PF-00547659 was characterized using a population PK approach. PK parameters including but not limited to AUC, CL and half life were estimated using data pooled from both typical and additional PK groups. Tmax is time for Cmax.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Total PF-00547659 - Terminal Half Life (Thalf)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total PF-00547659 was characterized using a population PK approach. PK parameters including but not limited to AUC, CL and half life were estimated using data pooled from both typical and additional PK groups. Thalf is terminal half life.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Total PF-00547659 - Apparent Clearance (CL/F)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total PF-00547659 was characterized using a population PK approach. PK parameters including but not limited to AUC, CL and half life were estimated using data pooled from both typical and additional PK groups. CL/F is apparent clearance.

arm_group.description: Placebo delivered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks.
Drug dose level 1 delivered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks.
Drug dose level 2 delievered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks.
Drug dose level 3 delivered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks.

intervention.description: Placebo delivered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks
Drug dose level 1 delivered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks
Drug dose level 2 delivered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks
Drug dose level 3 delivered SC, 3 doses separated by 4 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must have failed or are intolerant to anti-TNFs and/or immunosuppressants (AZA, 6-MP, and/or MTX).
- hsCRP greater than 3mg/L
- Ulcerations demonstrated by colonoscopy performed during screening or 8 weeks prior to screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breast feeding
- Short bowel syndrome due to multiple small bowel resections
- Presence of a stoma

clinical_study.keyword: Crohn's disease Safety Efficacy Pharmacokinetics Pharmacodynamics Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: In total, 265 participants were randomized and 262 entered the study and received study treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) 70 Response Rate
outcome.description: Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a number which consists of information collected from a 7-day diary from the participants regarding symptoms. Remission is considered a score of 150 or less. Active disease is considered 200 or greater. A response to therapy is considered a decline in CDAI score of 70-points from baseline. CDAI response rate at week 8 and week 12 was measured between the investigational product group and the placebo group.
outcome.population: The full analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Total PF-00547659 - Area Under the Concentration Time Profile From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time (AUCinf)
outcome.description: The Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total PF-00547659 was characterized using a population PK approach. PK parameters including but not limited to area under the concentration-time profile (AUC), clearance (CL) and half life were estimated using data pooled from both typical and additional PK groups. AUCinf is area under the concentration time profile from time zero extrapolated to infinite time.
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of investigational product and had data for at least 1 PK concentration were included in the PK concentration analysis.
